intro: Socratesia melastomoides, commonly known as the Florida melastome, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and swamps. It has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Socratesia melastomoides is an important species for local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
